GOVERNMENT OF ZAMBIA
ACT
No. 26 of 2016
Date of Assent: 6th June, 2016
An Act to prescribe the number of Ministers in accordance
with Article 116 of the Constitution; and provide for
matters connected with, or incidental to, the foregoing.
[ 7th June, 2016
ENACTED by the Parliament of Zambia. Enactment
1. This Act may be cited as the Ministers (Prescribed Number Short title
and Responsibilities) Act, 2016.
2. In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires, words Interpretation
and terms used in this Act have the meaning assigned to them in
the Constitution.
3. For purposes of Article 116 (1) of the Constitution, the Number of
number of Ministers to be appointed by the President shall not be Ministers
Cap. 1
more than thirty.
4. Without prejudice to the generality of Article 116 (2) of the Responsibili-
ties of
Constitution, a Minister is responsible for—
Minister
(a) the business of Government in the National Assembly Cap. 1
relating to the Minister’s statutory functions or control
and as assigned;
(b) the introduction and implementation of legislation, as
assigned; and
(c) provision to the National Assembly of information and
reports relating to matters under the Minister’s statutory
functions or control as the National Assembly requires.
5. The President may, by statutory instrument, make Regulations
regulations to give effect to the provisions of this Act.
